title: Great hotel
review: Wander around this quintessential neighborhood in the heart of Boston for high-end shops, restaurants, and the feeling of city bustle. Its most identifiable skyscrapers, the Prudential Center and John Hancock Tower, are highlights of the city skyline. Visit Newbury street to explore unique and trendy boutiques – as well as every other kind of store imaginable – all housed in beautiful brownstone buildings. In nice weather, restaurant patio seating is packed with Bostonians and tourists alike soaking up the sunshine and enjoying the food. Commonwealth Ave offers a beautiful stroll down residential tree-lined streets. Keep walking towards the Charles River and enjoy a beautiful view by the water. In warmer months, people run and bike on paths running along the esplanade, and sail and kayak on the Charles River. Boylston street, also full of shops, bars, and restaurants, is the finish line of the Boston Marathon. Head towards Copley Square and check out the Boston Public Library, which is particularly beautiful from the Dartmouth street entrance.

title: Best hotel in Boston
review: I had a great experience on a business trip. Clean, renovated rooms. Mine had a great view. Great location, near shopping and restaurants. Friendly staff. Excellent breakfast. I will certainly stay here next time I am in Boston.

title: Worst Hilton
review: I don’t know where to start. Everything about this hotel is terrific. First off, it is in a great location. Right by tons of bars, restaurants and shopping. Everything you could possibly need is within walking distance. Second, the service is top notch. You are welcomed as soon as you walk in and truly feel the staff wants to make your stay the best ever. The rooms are amazing, super clean and extremely comfortable. I never even consider another hotel when I’m in Boston and neither will you if you stay here.

title: Nice option in downtown Boston
review: Thank you Justin for providing such valuable feedback about your recent stay. Our staff will greatly appreciate this as they work hard everyday to provide this service to all of our guests. Your comments will keep our team motivated to continue to strive for excellent service.

title: Good location, typical "American" service
review: Wouldn’t stay here again. Lack of amenities. Very expensive. Horrible room service. Worse customer service.   Saw a front desk lady sitting and arguing with an elderly couple about not having a reservation (they ended up being at the wrong location), but she could have handled that so much kinder.   My phone never worked, I wish I would have took that as a sign and not ordered the gross room service from the front desk.

title: Boston visit
review: As a long time Hilton Honors member, I was shocked by this property. We had stayed at other downtown Boston hotels at the same level that were far superior. Our room had 2 plastic cups and no towel bars. There was a notice about re using to save the planet. There was only one bellman per shift and often only one person on the desk. I counted 8 people in line and one check in clerk. A guest told me he had been waiting an hour. Unacceptable! Getting a cab was a challenge as they were all parked at the Sheraton and often no one to call them. They need to take lessons from service from the Hampton Inns. Do not tell me next time will be better you blew your chance to make a good first impression.

title: Nice Hilton, great location, great property
review: Good location for seeing games at Fenway.  Pleasant staff and good, but not great rooms.  Good breakfast included. Substandard TV picture in room and very high priced snacks in lobby.  Will likely go across the street to Sheraton on next visit.

title: Back in the Back Bay
review: I had a conference at the Sheraton Boston, but is was sold out and I somehow found the Hilton Back Bay.  It is literally across the street from the Sheraton.    I loved the hotel, got a great room, nice view, excellent housekeeping who left me bottled water every day.  There are two small food shops in the lobby which was very convenient as well as a very good restaurant in the bar.  I loved that this hotel is in walking distance of a very lovely area for shopping and restaurants.  The Back Bay part of Boston is gorgeous -- I have been to Boston many times, but never in this area.  Other great points about the hotel:  there is a uber / lyft drop off site right in front which is convenient, parking and a nice gym.  The staff is great and very accomodating.  Try this hotel, you…

title: 4th of July visit
review: Staff was very friendly, professional and accommodating. Property was in great shape as always. Perfect location to get to the Prudential shops and Fenway area on foot. We didn’t use the self parking option but they have a conveniently located Uber/Lyft designated pickup area that made grabbing a ride hassle free.

title: Stay elsewhere- this property isn’t worth the price or comfort under its brand name
review: Spent 3 days visiting Boston to see Boston Pops and Fireworks. Hotel was within walking distance to Charles River and Fenway Park. Hotel is very upscale and updated. Very clean, staff are very friendly and helpful. On Old Time Trolley stop. Rooms are updated. Would definitely recommend and will stay again if in area.
